metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1624 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer underflow in the ProcessCommandsInternal function in dec/decode.c in Brotli, as used in Google Chrome before 48.0.2564.109, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted data with brotli compression.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1624` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

brotli - 0.3.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1
python-brotli - 0.3.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1
python3-brotli - 0.3.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 48.0.2564.116-0ubuntu1.1229
chromium-browser-l10n - 48.0.2564.116-0ubuntu1.1229
chromium-chromedriver - 48.0.2564.116-0ubuntu1.1229
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 48.0.2564.116-0ubuntu1.1229
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 48.0.2564.116-0ubuntu1.1229
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.12.6-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.12.6-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.12.6-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.12.6-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.12.6-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.12.6-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: brotli package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0.2564.116-0ubuntu1.1229').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.6-0ubuntu1').
